data.title: "How to contribute" page might be missing some information for a newcomer
data.body:
My environment was below:
- VSCode Version: Code 1.11.1 (d9484d12b38879b7f4cdd1150efeb2fd2c1fbf39, 2017-04-06T14:00:34.044Z)
- OS Version: Darwin x64 16.4.0
- Node Version: v6.10.2
- Npm Version: 3.10.10
- Extensions: none
I tried to install, build, and validate vscode following "How to Contribute" page on the Wiki. However, build and validation failed because the wiki might be missing some information.
Could you please consider the information that I wrote here.
---
## [Build process: "npm run watch"] 
You need to install 'gulp' because it is not automatically installed during the build.
![screen shot 2017-04-12 at 17 01 57](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/12183635/24947450/d539d3fa-1fa1-11e7-87e7-58f24cc8088d.png)

## [Validation process: "./scripts/code.sh"]
When you face on this error below: 
![screen shot 2017-04-12 at 16 58 28](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/12183635/24947310/4f6cc4b2-1fa1-11e7-82c0-41e57052df6a.png)

You should wipe node_modules and re-install, then try to execute validation!
(see https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/23834)

data.title: How to disable TypeScript for JS files
data.body:
Hi there,

I have `"javascript.validate.enable": false` in my config, but I still receive type suggestions (from TS?):

![img_2326-min](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/2273613/24949149/eb4d8270-1f6c-11e7-8a50-d2afe096c3c1.jpg)

- VSCode Version: 1.11.1
- OS Version: Sierra 10.12.4

**Steps to Reproduce:**

1. Disable validation
2. Open JS file
3. Hover variable / flowtype definition

**Desired outcome:**

- Display only flowtype suggestion (hide `Specification: (unknown)`)

data.title: Wrong or unnecessary translation of "Closure"
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code 1.11.1 (d9484d12b38879b7f4cdd1150efeb2fd2c1fbf39, 2017-04-06T13:58:12.954Z)
- OS Version: Windows_NT ia32 6.1.7601
- Extensions: 

|Extension|Author|Version|
|---|---|---|
|jshint|dbaeumer|0.10.15|
|githistory|donjayamanne|0.2.0|
|Theme-Dreamweaver|gerane|0.0.2|
|Theme-PastelsonDark|gerane|0.0.2|
|Theme-TwoStones|gerane|0.0.2|
|hopscotch|idleberg|0.1.4|
|crayon-vscode|jansenfuller|0.1.3|
|jscs-formatter|moose87|0.1.1|
|jscs|ms-vscode|0.1.9|;


---

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Debug a node.js application with the integrated node.js debugger
2. Hit a breakpoint
=> In the left panel there are several sections displayed i.e. for breakpoints and variables including the section for local, global and closure scople. The german translation "Abschluss" of the word "Closure" doesn't fit here it is actully more confusing. than it helps. In fact i would recommend to not translate this word to german because it's commonly used as it is "Closure".

I tried hard to find the translation inside the project to file a pull request but i couldn't find it.

data.title: Error with 'outFiles'
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code 1.11.1 (d9484d12b38879b7f4cdd1150efeb2fd2c1fbf39, 2017-04-06T13:58:12.954Z)
- OS Version: Windows_NT ia32 10.0.14393
- Extensions: 

|Extension|Author|Version|
|---|---|---|
|python|donjayamanne|0.6.0|
|theme-chrome-devtools-dark|ivanzusko|0.0.1|
|MagicPython|magicstack|1.0.9|
|mssql|ms-mssql|0.3.0|
|csharp|ms-vscode|1.8.1|
|python|tht13|0.2.3|;


---

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Wrote simple Python program: print("HI there!")

2. Used both F5 and Ctrl+F5 to debug and run w/o debugging. 

3. Get an error bar at the top that says, "Cannot launch program 'user path...\Python\py Test 01.py'; setting the 'outFiles' attribute might help. 

4. Debug Console has the message "Debugging with legacy protocol because Node v0.12.2 was detected."

5. Upgraded Node version to v6.10.2, but did not resolve the problem. 

I had some trouble setting this up on my Surface, but finally got that working by fixing the paths. I tried to do the same here, but this is a new error that I'm not familiar with. I haven't been able to find much help online. Any help or suggestions would be greatly appreciated.

data.title: Implement support for syncing all settings
data.body: Please implement a way to sync settings (Theme, Keyboard bindings, installed extensions etc.) across multiple computers without having to use 3rd party extensions or hacks.

data.title: Add the Chinese document translated from English
data.body: It's a repo about vscode document from vsc community in China.

data.title: [Feature request] Show tooltips with hints for `tsconfig.*.json` files
data.body:
Tooltips with hints are shown on hover over properties in editor for `tsconfig.json` files, but are not shown for `tsconfig.*.json` files. Use of `tsconfig.*.json` is quite common, so it is suggested to show tooltips for `tsconfig.*.json` also.

![untitled](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/4777512/24941579/312f58ea-1f54-11e7-9a45-ebed07fbffb0.png)

data.title: Snippets No Longer Work in Comments
data.body:
Hi VSCode contributors,

I have been finding since last week's update that using a snippet in a comment doesn't produce the output of the snippet. I've only checked for JavaScript and SQL; the issue was present in both languages, so I'll assume it's something special about comments in general.

Maybe it was an intentional change in the handling of snippets, but I suspect it's a bug, so I'll submit an issue for it.

- VSCode Version: 1.11.1
- OS Version: Mac OS X 10.11.6

Steps to Reproduce:

1. try using a snippet inside a comment

data.title: Fixes #944 - Support wildcards on activationEvents.workspaceContains
data.body: Here is a first pass at this -- I don't really like checking for wildcard/glob characters but it works as is and should be easy enough to change that part if the rest looks reasonable.

data.title: Changed git renamed icon to orange color

Changed both dark and light `status-renamed.svg` to have `#CC6633` background color to allow for better distinction as mentioned by issue referenced.

data.title: Supporting three-character hex color code shorthand in TM themes
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.12.0-insider
- OS Version: Windows 10

In the course of attempting to style support.function scopes in a theme, I've run into this issue:

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/2985/24939444/533d41e8-1f0b-11e7-83fc-9dcc763702b7.png)

It classifies the function correctly, the tooltip even includes the defined color (#CFA), but the foreground is still #F1F2F3.

```json
// Place your settings in this file to overwrite the default settings
{

    "terminal.integrated.fontSize": 10,

    "diffEditor.renderSideBySide": false,

        "**/.git": true,
        "**/.svn": true,

        "**/__pycache__/**": true

    "window.zoomLevel": 0
}
```

data.title: Make border bottom visible for panel actions on focus.
data.body:
Fixes #23947

Actions where the same height as parent container causing bottom border to not display. 
Fixed by making actions 1px smaller so that bottom border matches top border.

data.title: Arrow keys completely stopped working in Code
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code 1.11.1 (d9484d12b38879b7f4cdd1150efeb2fd2c1fbf39, 2017-04-06T13:55:56.395Z)
- OS Version: Linux x64 4.4.0-72-generic
- Extensions: 

|Extension|Author|Version|
|---|---|---|
|Go|lukehoban|0.6.59|;


---

Steps to Reproduce:

I was typing, and all of a sudden my arrow keys no longer work inside VS Code.  They work in every other application, just not Code.  I've tried:

1) Signing off/in
2) rebooting the Linux machine
3) rebooting my Windows host machine (I'm using VS Code inside a Linux machine via Remote Desktop)
4) Pressing all the shift/control/etc keys on my keyboard
5) Scroll lock etc
6) Num lock
7) Checked that I don't have key mapping overrides

Still can't use the arrow keys at all.  This makes it nearly impossible to use.

data.title: Add selection command concatenates selections when selected terms are next to each other
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.11.1
- OS Version: Windows 8.1

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Click on File -> New File
2. Type the following text: `cat dog cat cat dog`
3. Select first occurrence of cat with space immediately after it (first four characters)
4. Press ctrl+d three times

Second and third occurrence of word cat will become one selection. Three occurrences of a word cat (plus space) will become only two selections. If only cat was selected initially (without space after it) then everything would work as expected resulting with three selections.

data.title: [Feature Request] Able to cycle windows in Zen mode
data.body:
Hi,

I would like to be able to cycle windows in Zen mode.

- VSCode Version: 1.11.1
- OS Version: macOS Sierra 10.12.3

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Open two windows.
2. From one window, go to Zen mode by _Command+K Z_
3. Cannot cycle windows by _Shift+Command+Tilde_
4. Exit Zen mode, now I can cycle windows by _Shift+Command+Tilde_

Request: vscode should allow user to cycle windows in Zen mode in step 3.

Regards,
Ky

data.title: Focus search input box by shortcut
data.body:
# VSCode Version
1.11.1

# OS Version
OS X EI Captian - 10.11.1

# Steps to Reproduce
1. just edit(or focus) some file ( `ctrl + n` )
2. use shortcut*1 to focus on **EXPLORER** first
3. then use shortcut*2 to focus on **_SEARCH_**
4. u will see u now  focus on input box in **_SEARCH_** 

BUT ❗️❗️❗️

U cant focus on input box if u jump from **step 1** to **step 3** without doing **step 2** 

WHY ❓❓❓

# NOTE
*1 : Default is `cmd + shift + E`, but i modified it to `ctrl + shift + E`
*2 : Default is `cmd + shift + F`, but i modified it to `ctrl + shift + F`

data.title: unconfirmed text of CJK IME collapse to one character
data.body:
This problem is introduced by Electron 1.6.x, it's the same issue as https://github.com/Microsoft/monaco-editor/issues/320, but we didn't fix all the problems via https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/commit/eb08a8df708e7b0947bb122c8e6e8b102187c484 but that fix targets v55 but Electron 1.6.x ships with Chrome v56.

![cjk](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/876920/24936428/107ebe18-1ede-11e7-9371-59ed42f72297.gif)

We need to 

1. Check Chrome version, both v55 and v56 are wrong about composition update
2. When we receive compositionUpdate event, textarea doesn't get updated yet so the value of the texarea is obsolete. We need to postpone the specialized composition update for Chrome v55/56 to `onInput` event.

cc @bpasero @alexandrudima

data.title: Unhandled exception occurs in findGit when extension debugging with the Insiders build
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.12.0-Insiders
- OS Version: All
